intro: Oreomyrrhis ciliata, commonly known as the fringed galleta, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as slopes and plains, and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinctive fringed appearance, while its flowers are usually white or pale green. Oreomyrrhis ciliata plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
